intro: Oxydectes luziana, commonly known as the Luzon tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk covered in a thick layer of persistent, dark brown to blackish fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of large, feather-like fronds that can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Oxydectes luziana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
